intro: Cuthbertia graminea, commonly known as the slender cuthbertia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its slender stems and narrow, grass-like leaves give it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months.
